item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Monday, March 10, 2025 at 6:20 PM UTC
item.description:
1. uBlock Origin is no longer available on the Chrome Store (371 points | 178 comments)
2. Canon EF and RF Lenses – All Autofocus Motors (255 points | 65 comments)
3. Show HN: Editable Games (76 points | 17 comments)
4. DOJ: Google must sell Chrome, Android could be next (40 points | 1 comment)
5. Music labels will regret coming for the Internet Archive, sound historian says (125 points | 30 comments)
6. Show HN: In-Browser Graph RAG with Kuzu-WASM and WebLLM (51 points | 10 comments)
7. Software-Defined Radio for Engineers (2018) [pdf] (8 points | discuss)
8. Wall Street sell-off turns 'ugly' as US recession fears grow (30 points | discuss)
9. Performance of the Python 3.14 tail-call interpreter (420 points | 128 comments)
10. A technical history of Acorn Computers (33 points | 9 comments)

13. 3dfx, So powerful, it's kind of ridiculous (2023) (160 points | 150 comments)
14. Trees not profits: we're giving up our right to ever sell Ecosia (2018) (217 points | 140 comments)

20. Chasing RFI Waves – Part Seven (273 points | 96 comments)
21. Ecosia is teaming up with Qwant to build a European search index (448 points | 160 comments)
22. YouTube DRM added on ALL videos with TV (TVHTML5) clients (58 points | 5 comments)
23. Does Visual Studio Rot the Mind? (2005) (70 points | 66 comments)
24. Exploring Polymorphism in C: Lessons from Linux and FFmpeg's Code Design (2019) (192 points | 75 comments)
25. Ceramic powders with Archimedean shapes resist extreme heat and oxidation (9 points | discuss)
26. It is as if you were on your phone (778 points | 124 comments)
27. A Post Mortem on the Gino Case (151 points | 83 comments)
28. Bispecific antibodies potently neutralize SARS-CoV-2 variants of concern (346 points | 96 comments)
29. Ancient human DNA recovered from a Palaeolithic pendant (33 points | 2 comments)
30. Bring Back Shortwave (155 points | 101 comments)
